skills_data.description: Compilation of Skills for Star Wars SAGA Edition.

skills_list.name: Acrobatics

common_uses.description: Move at half speed along a narrow surface. DC varies with surface width. If surface is slippery or unstable, increase DC by 5. You are considered flat-footed while balancing, unless trained in Acrobatics. If you take damage while balancing, make another Acrobatics check against the same DC to keep from falling.

dc.notes: You are considered flat-footed while balancing unless trained in Acrobatics. If you take damage while balancing, you must immediately make another Acrobatics check against the same DC to keep from falling. Reference CRB p.63 for full DC table. [cite: 405]

common_uses.action_cost: Part of movement (move at half speed)

common_uses.description: Move through difficult terrain at your normal speed. [cite: 406]
Slip free of restraints, wriggle through a tight space, or escape from a grapple.

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.64 for specific DC values. [cite: 407]

common_uses.time_to_perform: Attack action to escape a grapple. Full-round action to escape a net or to move 1 square through a tight space. 1 minute to escape from ropes, binder cuffs, or manacles. [cite: 407]

common_uses.description: Drop to a prone position as a free action instead of a swift action. [cite: 407]

Treat a fall as if it were 3 meters (2 squares) shorter when determining damage. For every 10 points by which you beat this DC, you can subtract an additional 3 meters from the fall. If you take no damage from the fall, you land on your feet. If struck by a falling object, a successful check reduces damage by half.

common_uses.use_name: Stand Up from Prone (as Swift Action)
common_uses.description: Stand up from a prone position as a swift action instead of a move action. [cite: 409]

Tumble through the threatened area or fighting space of an enemy as part of your move action without provoking an attack of opportunity. Each threatened square or occupied square that you tumble through counts as 2 squares of movement.

skills_list.description_general: You can move at normal speed across difficult terrain, keep your balance while walking on a narrow surface, take less damage from a fall, slip free of restraints or a grappling foe, and get up from prone safely. In addition to the specific options listed below, you can use Acrobatics to perform typical tumbling, flipping, or gymnastic maneuvers. [cite: 404]
special_rules_summary: You can't take 10 or take 20 on an Acrobatics check. [cite: 410]
If you are trained in Acrobatics, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense when fighting defensively (see Fighting Defensively, page 152). [cite: 410]

skills_list.name: Climb

common_uses.description: Advance up, down, or across a slope or a wall or other steep incline (or even a ceiling with handholds). A slope is <60 degrees; a wall is >=60 degrees. Climb at one-half speed as a full-round action, or one-fourth speed as a move action. Failure by 5+ means you fall.

details.condition: Slope too steep to walk up; knotted rope with a wall to brace against.
Rope with a wall to brace against or a knotted rope, but not both.
Surface with adequate handholds/footholds (rough natural rock, tree); unknotted rope.
Overhang or ceiling with handholds but no footholds.

modifiers.condition: Climbing inside air duct (brace against two opposite walls)
Climbing a corner (brace against perpendicular walls)

dc.notes: Perfectly smooth, flat, vertical surface cannot be climbed. Opponents get +2 to attack you; you lose DEX to Reflex Defense. If you take damage, make a Climb check against wall's DC to avoid falling. Reference CRB p.65 for full DC table.

common_uses.description: Climb more quickly than normal, but take a -5 penalty on Climb checks. Allows climbing at full speed as a full-round action, or one-half speed as a move action. [cite: 416]
Attempt to catch yourself on a wall while falling. [cite: 416]
Make your own handholds/footholds by pounding pitons or cutting into ice. Reduces Climb DC of that surface to 15. [cite: 417]

dc.notes: Requires appropriate tools (pitons, ice axe).

common_uses.time_to_perform: 1 minute per piton (one piton needed per meter).

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to scale a cliff, to get to a window on the second story of a building, or to climb up an antenna array after falling out of an airway at the bottom of a floating city. [cite: 411]
special_rules_summary: Someone using a rope can haul a character by strength.
You can take 10 while climbing, but you can't take 20. [cite: 418]

skills_list.name: Deception

common_uses.description: Produce a deceptive appearance (disguise, forged documents). Make a Deception check opposed by Perception of any target. Success means target believes appearance is authentic. Rushing incurs -10 penalty.

modifiers_based_on_difficulty.description: Works in target's favor or matches expectations. Ex: convincing junk dealer to buy stolen droids; simple disguise.
Believable, doesn't affect target much. Ex: convincing suspicious guard you're not a thief; disguise as different species/gender.
Hard to believe, puts target at risk, or undergoes scrutiny. Ex: convincing thugs you can beat them; impersonating officer; false documents passing electronic screening.
Very hard to believe, sizable risk to target, intense scrutiny. Ex: convincing dealer to buy stolen Imperial shuttle; impersonating someone to an old friend.
Almost too unlikely, requires material you don't have. Ex: impersonating a Jedi to fool another Jedi; claiming to be Emperor giving orders.

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.66 for Difficulty Modifiers.

common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies: At least 1 minute for simple, up to 2 weeks for outrageous.

common_uses.description: Communicate deceptive information (lie, distort facts). Make Deception check against Will Defense of target. Success means target believes information. Rushing incurs -10 penalty. If combined with deceptive appearance, compare single check to both Perception and Will Defense, or make separate checks if different timings.

dc.notes: Failure by 10 or less may mean target believes but is reluctant if risky. Failure by 11+ means target sees through deception. Reference CRB p.66 for Difficulty Modifiers.

common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies: At least Standard Action for simple, up to 1 minute+ for difficult/outrageous. [cite: 422]

common_uses.description: Use Deception to help you hide. Successful Deception check (vs. target's Will Defense) gives momentary diversion needed to attempt a Stealth check while target is aware.
common_uses.action_cost: (Deception part) Varies, then Stealth check as move action.

common_uses.description: Make a Deception check as a standard action to set the DC of your opponent's Initiative check. If you beat opponent's roll, target is flat-footed against your first attack next round. -5 penalty vs. non-humanoids or INT < 3. [cite: 433]

skills_list.description_general: You can make the untrue seem true, the outrageous seem plausible, and the nefarious seem ordinary. The skill encompasses conning, fast-talking, misdirection, forgery, disguise, and outright lying. [cite: 419]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: Generally, a failed Deception check makes the target too suspicious for another attempt in the same circumstances. For feinting in combat, you may retry freely. [cite: 434]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a deception (except for feinting in combat), but you can't take 20. [cite: 434]

skills_list.name: Endurance

common_uses.description: Each hour of walking after 8 hours requires a DC 10 Endurance check (+2 DC per hour after the first). Failure means -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by 8 hours rest). [cite: 435]

Hold breath for rounds equal to CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each round (+2 DC per additional round). Failure: must breathe or -1 step on condition track. Unconscious at bottom of track; die next turn if still unable to breathe. [cite: 436]

Go without food for days equal to CON modifier (min 1). Then, DC 10 Endurance check each day (+2 DC per day thereafter). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by nutritious meal). [cite: 437]

Go without water for hours equal to 3x CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each hour (+2 DC per day thereafter from original text, likely means +2 per hour). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by drinking ~1 liter water).

dc.notes: CRB text mentions '+2 each day thereafter' for thirst, but context suggests per hour is more likely intended for hourly checks.

common_uses.description: Run as full-round action up to 4x speed (3x in heavy armor/load). Lose DEX to Reflex. Run for rounds = CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each round (+1 DC per previous check). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by resting for same duration as run; can only move speed during this rest).
Sleep in armor with Endurance check (DC 10 light, DC 15 medium, DC 20 heavy). Failure: no sleep, -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by 8 hours sleep). [cite: 441]
Each hour swimming: DC 15 Endurance check (+2 DC per consecutive hour). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by resting for same duration as swim). Treading water reduces DC by 5.

skills_list.description_general: You can push yourself beyond your normal physical limits. [cite: 435]

skills_list.name: Gather Information

common_uses.description: Unearth major news/popular local rumors. Learning detailed facts or veracity of rumor requires higher DC and bribes.
Acquire info unavailable to general public (classified reports, hidden locations, security procedures, access codes). Especially difficult info has higher DC/cost. Failure by 5+ alerts someone.
Find a specific individual (by name or by need for their skill/item/info). Higher DC if target is unknown or concealed.

options.condition: Target not well known or concealed

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to make contacts, learn local new stories and gossip, and acquire secrets. [cite: 442]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on a Gather Information check, but you can't take 20. [cite: 446]
A successful Persuasion check can reduce the monetary cost of a Gather Information check. [cite: 446]
Some information is beyond the reach of this skill (GM discretion). [cite: 446]

skills_list.name: Initiative

common_uses.description: An Initiative check sets the order of combat when a fight starts. Each character aware of the fight makes an Initiative check and goes in order from highest to lowest. When piloting a vehicle in combat, you must apply the vehicle's size modifier to your Initiative check.

dc.notes: Sets turn order.

common_uses.description: When an opponent attempts to feint in combat, you oppose their Deception check with an Initiative check. If you meet or beat their check result, their feint attempt fails.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to gain the advantage in combat.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on an Initiative check, but you can't take 20.

skills_list.name: Jump

common_uses.description: The DC of a running long jump is equal to the distance cleared (in meters) multiplied by 3. For example, clearing a 3-meter-wide (2-square-wide) pit requires a successful DC 9 Jump check. If you do not get at least a 4-square running start, the DC is doubled.

The DC of a running high jump is equal to the distance cleared (in meters) multiplied by 12. For example, landing atop a 1.5-meter-high (1-square-high) ledge requires a successful DC 18 Jump check. If you use a pole of sufficient height to help you vault the distance, the DC is halved. If you do not get at least a 4-square running start, the DC is doubled.

If you intentionally jump down from a height, you can attempt a DC 15 Jump check to take falling damage as if you had dropped 3 meters (2 squares) fewer than you actually did. For every 10 points by which you beat the DC, you can subtract an additional 3 meters from the fall when determining damage (CR Errata p.290). If you succeed on this check and take no damage, you land on your feet.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to leap over pits, vault low fences, or jump down from a tree's lowest branches.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Jump check.
If there is no danger associated with failing, you can take 20.
Distance covered by a long jump or high jump counts against your maximum movement in a round; distance covered by jumping down does not.

common_uses.action_cost: Usually free action or part of other action

common_uses.description: Answer a question within bureaucracy that requires some level of expertise.

skills_list.description_general: Represents study of bureaucracy: Business procedures, legal systems and regulations, and organizational structures.

skills_list.name: Mechanics

common_uses.description: Disarm a security device, defeat a lock or trap, or rig a device to fail. Requires security kit. Failure by 5+ springs trap or device appears disabled but isn't.

details.condition: Simple device (sabotage mechanical, jam blaster, bypass basic mechanical lock)
Tricky device (sabotage electronic, bypass basic electronic lock)
Complex device (disarm electronic security, bypass complex lock)

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.70

common_uses.description: Connect a detonator to an explosive. Failure means explosive fails to go off. Failure by 10+ means it goes off during installation. Can set a higher disarm DC (New Set Detonator DC = Chosen Disarm DC - 5).

dc.notes: DC can be increased if setting a higher disarm DC.

common_uses.description: Carefully place explosive against fixed structure/vehicle for maximum effect. GM makes check. DC 15: ignore target's DR. DC 25: double damage. DC 35: triple damage. Normal damage to other targets in burst.
Disarm an explosive set to go off. Requires security kit. DC usually 15 unless setter chose higher. Failure by 5+ detonates explosive.

dc.notes: DC can be higher if set by another character.

common_uses.description: Make temporary repairs to disabled mechanical/electronic device. Success gains +2 steps on condition track. Device moves -5 steps and disables again at end of scene/encounter. Tool kit grants +5 bonus.
Make a Mechanics check to modify a droid (see Modifying Droids, p.197). Requires tool kit.

dc.description: DC varies by modification, see CRB p.197.

common_uses.description: When acting as shield operator on vehicle or device with shield rating, spend three swift actions (same or consecutive turns) to make DC 20 Mechanics check. Success restores 5 SR points (up to max).
When acting as engineer on vehicle or device, spend three swift actions to make DC 20 Mechanics check. Success moves vehicle +1 step on condition track.
Repair a damaged or disabled droid. Restores HP equal to droid's character level and removes persistent conditions. Droid repairing self takes -5 penalty. Requires tool kit.

Repair a damaged or disabled object (device/vehicle). Restores 1d8 HP and removes persistent conditions. If on board damaged vehicle, apply vehicle's condition track penalties to check. Requires tool kit.

skills_list.description_general: You can bypass locks and traps, set and disarm explosives, fix malfunctioning devices, and modify and repair damaged droids.
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: You can usually retry a Mechanics check. In some specific cases (e.g., Disable Device, Set Detonator, Disarm Explosive), a failed check has negative ramifications that prevent or alter repeated checks.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 or take 20 on a Mechanics check.
When making a Mechanics check to accomplish a jury-rig repair, you can't take 20.
CR Errata p.290: Characters who are untrained in the Mechanics skill can still use the aid another action to assist on Mechanics checks.

skills_list.name: Perception

common_uses.description: A Perception check made at the start of a battle determines whether or not you are surprised. This is a reaction. [cite: 467, 1056]

dc.description: Compared against opponent's Stealth or circumstances.

common_uses.description: Listen to a conversation. Base DC 10. DC 15 in relatively noisy areas (cantina), DC 25 in loud areas (droid factory). Must understand language. [cite: 468]
Detect and identify distant or ambient noises.

Spot or hear targets. Opposed by target's Stealth if actively hiding. If not hiding, DC based on target size (Colossal -15 to Fine +25). Modifiers: -5 per 10 squares distance; -5 for concealment/cover; -10 for total concealment/cover. Detecting target entering line of sight is a reaction; actively looking/listening is standard action.
Notice if a character has a concealed weapon or object. Opposed by target's Stealth. Success by 5+ identifies object type. [cite: 471]
common_uses.action_cost: Reaction or Standard Action (part of noticing target)

common_uses.description: Carefully examine a 1-square area or 1-cubic-meter volume. DC 15 finds clues, hidden compartments, secret doors, traps, irregularities. GM may increase DC for obscure features.

dc.notes: GM may increase for very obscure/well-hidden features.

common_uses.description: Search a character for concealed items. Opposed by target's Stealth. +10 circumstance bonus if physically touching target (requires full-round action, target willing/pinned/helpless).
common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies (Perception check can be reaction, physical search is full-round action).

common_uses.description: See through deceptive appearances made using Deception skill. Opposed by Deception check result. [cite: 473]
Determine if someone is under mind-affecting Force power or coercion (if not obvious). DC 20.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to perceive threats as well as your surroundings. Distance, barriers, and concealment affect Perception checks.
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: You can make a Perception check every time you have the opportunity to notice something as a reaction. As a swift action, you may attempt to see or hear something that you failed (or believe you failed) to notice previously.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 or take 20 when making a Perception check.
Taking 20 means you spend 2 minutes attempting to notice something.

skills_list.name: Persuasion

common_uses.description: Adjust the attitude of a creature (INT 2+) using words/body language. Target must see you. Apply modifier based on target's current attitude (Hostile -10, Unfriendly -5, Indifferent -2, Friendly +0). Success (vs. target's Will Defense) shifts attitude one step in your favor. -5 penalty if target can't understand your speech. Attempt once per encounter per creature.

Reduce by half the credits cost for Gather Information, or increase/reduce sell price of an item by 50%. DC depends on target's attitude (Unfriendly DC 30, Indifferent DC 25, Friendly DC 20, Helpful DC 15). Cannot haggle with hostile or INT 2- creatures. Cannot make creature pay more than standard price if item easily obtained elsewhere.
common_uses.action_cost: Swift Action (for Gather Info cost reduction), Full-round Action (for item price)

common_uses.description: Force a creature (INT 1+) to back down, surrender item, reveal info, or flee. Target must see you. Check vs. target's Will Defense. Apply modifier based on perceived threat (Target helpless +5 to You helpless -15). Cannot force life-endangering actions. Successfully intimidated creature becomes one step more hostile once threat passes.

threat_modifiers.situation: Target is helpless or completely at your mercy
Target is clearly outnumbered or disadvantaged
Target is evenly matched with you
You are clearly outnumbered or disadvantaged
You are helpless or completely at the target's mercy

skills_list.description_general: You can influence others with your tact, subtlety, and social grace, or you can threaten them into being more cooperative.
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: If you fail a Persuasion check (Change Attitude or Intimidate), you cannot make any further Persuasion checks against that creature for that purpose for 24 hours. Haggle retries are not specified but likely limited by GM.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on a Persuasion check, but you can't take 20.

skills_list.name: Pilot

common_uses.description: Reduce or negate damage from a collision. (See Vehicle Combat rules, CR p.173) [cite: 482, 1192]
Engage in a dogfight. (See Vehicle Combat rules, CR p.171)
Make a Pilot check instead of an Initiative check to determine place in initiative order when piloting a vehicle in combat. [cite: 483, 1199]

Push vehicle beyond normal limits. Failure: vehicle speed not increased, vehicle moves -1 step on condition track. Success: speed increases by 1 square until start of next turn. For every 5 points exceeding DC, speed increases by additional 1 square. Can't take 10 on this check.
Intentionally collide with a target. (See Vehicle Combat rules, CR p.172)

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to operate a vehicle. Basic operation does not require a check, but evasive maneuvers and difficult stunts do. Vehicle's size modifier applies to Pilot checks.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Pilot check except when attempting to increase a vehicle's speed.
You can't take 20 on a Pilot check.

skills_list.name: Ride

common_uses.description: Typical riding actions (saddle, mount, ride, dismount) don't require checks. Mounting/dismounting is a move action. Checks required for combat or extreme circumstances, trick riding, or unusual animal actions.

dc.description: No DC for basic riding; specific tasks have DCs.

common_uses.description: Control a mount in combat. Failure means you can do nothing else that round. No roll needed for animals trained for battle.
Mount or dismount as a swift action. Failure means it's a move action. [cite: 487] (Errata: ACP applies only here)
React instantly to guide mount with knees to use both hands. Check at start of round. Failure means one hand needed to control mount.
common_uses.action_cost: Part of round's actions (check at start)

common_uses.description: Get mount to leap obstacles. Use your Ride skill or mount's Jump skill, whichever is lower. DC 15 Ride check to stay on mount when it leaps.
React instantly when you fall off a mount to avoid damage. Failure means 1d6 falling damage. [cite: 489] (Errata: Reaction timing for Use Mount as Cover implies this is also reaction [cite: 2014])
React instantly to avoid falling when mount rears/bolts or you take damage.
React instantly (Errata: as reaction to attack against you [cite: 2014]) to drop and hang alongside mount, using it as 1/2 cover. Can't attack while doing so. Failure means no cover. [cite: 490]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to ride any kind of mount, such as a tauntaun, dewback, or bantha.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Ride check, but you can't take 20.
Errata (p.298): Armor Check Penalty applies only when attempting to fast mount or fast dismount.

skills_list.name: Stealth

common_uses.description: Your Stealth check sets DC for Perception checks to notice you. Modifiers: -2 for hampering circumstances (e.g. debris), +2 for favorable (abundant hiding places). Moving > speed: -5 penalty. Moving > 2x speed: -10 penalty. Size modifiers apply (Fine +20 to Colossal -20).

Conceal an item (at least one size smaller than you) on your person. Modifiers based on object's relative size: One size smaller -5, two sizes smaller +0, three +5, four+ +10. Opposed by Perception. Drawing concealed item is standard action (Errata p.290 [cite: 1970]).
Use Deception (vs. target's Will Defense) to get momentary diversion to make a Stealth check while target is aware. Must reach hiding place as move action.

Pilfer a small, hand-sized object from target within reach. Stealth opposed by target's Perception (+5 bonus to target). Fail by 4 or less: no item, target unaware. Fail by 5+: no item, target catches you. (Errata p.298[cite: 2015]: Standard action)

Palm hand-sized objects, perform minor legerdemain, or minor action unnoticed (flip switch, pull detonator, draw pistol under table). Opposed by observer's Perception. (Errata p.298[cite: 2015]: Standard action)
After ranged attack from hiding (at least 2 squares from target, target unaware), try to hide again. New Stealth check with -10 penalty as move action. Success: remain hidden.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to slink past a sentry without being heard, catch your enemy off-guard, snipe from a concealed location, or perform sleight of hand.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Stealth check, but you can't take 20.

skills_list.name: Survival

common_uses.description: Avoid natural hazards, keep self fed and safe in wild for 24 hours. Can provide for one additional person per 2 points check exceeds 10. [cite: 499]
Ignore effects of extreme cold or heat for 24 hours. Requires field kit. [cite: 499]
Ascertain which direction is north (if applicable).
Find or follow tracks. DC depends on surface and circumstances (see table CRB p.75). Make new check when tracks become difficult. Move at half speed while tracking; normal speed incurs -5 penalty.

circumstance_modifiers.condition: Every hour of rain since trail made
Fresh snow cover since trail made

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.75 for full DC table and modifiers.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to hunt and forage, guide a party safely through arid wastelands, identify signs that gundarks live nearby, or avoid quicksand and other natural hazards.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Survival check.
You can take 20 if there is no danger or penalty for failure, but it takes twenty times as long as normal.

skills_list.name: Swim

common_uses.description: Swim one-quarter speed as move action, or one-half speed as full-round action. Roll once per round. Failure: no progress. Failure by 5+: go underwater, must hold breath (Endurance skill) until reaching surface with a successful Swim check.

skills_list.description_general: Using this skill, a land-based creature can swim, dive, navigate underwater obstacles, and so on.
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: A new check is allowed the round after a check is failed.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Swim check, but you can't take 20.

skills_list.name: Treat Injury

common_uses.description: Administer first aid to unconscious/wounded creature. Requires medpac. Success: creature regains HP = character level +1 per point check exceeds DC. Medical kit: +2 equip bonus. Creature can only benefit once per 24 hrs. Self-aid: -5 penalty.

Tend creature for 8 consecutive hours. Creature regains HP = character level (in addition to natural healing). Benefit once per 24 hrs. Can tend 1 creature (untrained) or up to 6 (trained). Cannot give to self.

dc.notes: Success is automatic if time commitment is met.

common_uses.description: Perform surgery to heal damage. Requires surgery kit. Success: heal HP = target's CON bonus (min 1) x target's level. Failure: target takes damage = its damage threshold. If target was at 0 HP, it dies (unless Force Point spent). Self-surgery: -5 penalty. Also removes persistent conditions.
Install cybernetic prosthesis. Requires Cybernetic Surgery feat and surgery kit. Success: prosthesis installed. Failure: not installed, can try again after another hour. Self-surgery: -5 penalty.
Revive a creature that just died (within 1 round). Requires medical kit. Success: creature unconscious instead of dead. Failure: cannot revive. Medpac: +2 equip bonus.

Treat a diseased character. Requires medical kit. Success vs. disease's DC: patient cured, persistent conditions from disease removed. Can treat 1 (untrained) or up to 6 (trained) simultaneously. [cite: 512]
Treat a poisoned character. Requires medical kit. Success vs. poison's DC: poison detoxified, persistent conditions from poison removed.

Treat an irradiated character. Requires medical kit. Success vs. radiation's DC: patient cured, persistent conditions from radiation removed. Can treat 1 (untrained) or up to 6 (trained) simultaneously.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to keep a badly wounded friend from dying, to heal the injured, or to treat a diseased or poisoned character.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Treat Injury check, but you can't take 20.

skills_list.name: Use Computer

common_uses.description: Connect to network (DC 10 if remote, full-round action) or use computer's local memory. Find info on topic (see table for DC/time). Computer must be indifferent or better. Secret info requires helpful computer.

dc.notes: DC 10 to connect to network remotely.

common_uses.description: Plot a safe course through hyperspace. DC varies by factors (see Astrogation, CRB p.237).
Disable or erase a program on a helpful computer. [cite: 520]

Adjust computer's attitude to gain access. Check vs. computer's Will Defense. Modifiers: Hostile -10, Unfriendly -5, Indifferent -2, Friendly +0. Success: attitude shifts one step better. Fail: no change. Fail by 5+: attitude one step worse, admin notified. Hostile computer on fail by 5+ traces location, isolates connection for 24 hrs.

Issue routine command (on/off, view/edit docs, print, open/close doors). Requires friendly or better computer. No check usually. Opposed Use Computer if contradictory command by another with same computer attitude.
Reprogram droid (new master, copy data, change trained skills, erase memory). Requires tool kit. DC = droid's Will Defense. [cite: 525]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to access secured files and defeat security systems.
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on Use Computer checks.
You can take 20 on a Use Computer check except when attempting to improve access.
When a computer is friendly or helpful toward you, you gain an equipment bonus on all Use Computer checks made with that computer equal to its Intelligence bonus.

skills_list.name: Use the Force

common_uses.description: Make a Use the Force check to use a Force power. [cite: 527]
common_uses.action_cost: No action (part of Force power activation).

common_uses.description: Enter a Force trance. Remain aware. Each hour, regain HP = character level. Emerge as swift action. 4 consecutive hours = full 8-hour rest. Go 10x longer without food/water.
Telekinetically lift/move object up to 5kg, 6 squares. DC 15 to use object as projectile (1d6 bludgeoning damage if Use the Force check beats target's Reflex Defense).
common_uses.action_cost: Move Action (to move), Standard Action (to use as projectile)

common_uses.description: Determine if a particular action will yield favorable/unfavorable results in immediate future (10 min or less). Answer doesn't account for long-term consequences.

Automatically sense strong dark side disturbances (1 km), or kin in mortal danger (10,000 light years), or major galactic disturbances. DC 15 Use the Force check (full-round) to determine distance/direction. Actively sense other Force-users (full-round) up to 100km (DC 15); success reveals number, approx. distance/direction, if met before. Opposed by target's Use the Force to conceal. (Errata p.299[cite: 2015]: Can specify sensing only Dark Side users.)
Ignore effects of cover and concealment for Perception checks until start of next turn. DC +5 if vs. total cover. [cite: 534] (Errata p.299 [cite: 2016])

Establish telepathic link with distant creature (INT 2+). Exchange emotions or single thought. DC based on distance (see table CRB p.78). Vs. unwilling target, check vs. target's Will Defense (or base skill DC, whichever higher, Errata p.299 [cite: 2016]); fail means no attempt for 24 hrs unless target becomes willing.

skills_list.description_general: You draw upon the Force to help you recover from injuries, gain special insights, or perform other remarkable acts. Requires the Force Sensitivity feat to be trained or use most applications.
special_rules_summary: You can't make Use the Force checks unless you have the Force Sensitivity feat.
Use the Force is a class skill for any character with the Force Sensitivity feat (Errata p.62 for Table 4-2 implies this is how it becomes a class skill).
You can take 10 on a Use the Force check, but you can't take 20.
